item.title: Automating Product Availability Alerts
item.description:
Problem: I’m renovating my kitchen. The Ikea sink I want is currently unavailable but may be back in stock any day, though Ikea’s website requires its users to jump through some hoops in determining the sink’s availabilty.

Solution: I made a web service that monitors the Ikea website and sends me a text message if the sink is suddenly in stock again.

Tool chain: Rake, Capybara, Poltergeist, Sinatra, Twilio, and Heroku.

item.title: Deploying an Express App to Heroku
item.description:
Some coworkers expressed interest in deploying Express apps to Heroku. These instructions seek to provide a basic overview, though Heroku offers much more robust documentation in its dev center.

Step 1: Create a Heroku account.

Step 2: Install the Heroku Toolbelt, which includes the Heroku command line client, Git, and Foreman.

Step 3: Log in by entering the following in the command line:

heroku login

item.title: Using South on a Heroku-hosted Django Project
item.description:
Problem: You need to add new fields to the admin of a Django project hosted on Heroku but don’t want to destroy data by running syncdb on your Heroku-hosted database.

Solution: South.

These instructions assume you’re working in a clean checkout of a Heroku project named heroku_project, which contains a Django project named django_project, which contains an app named django_app. You need to add a new admin field to django_app.

  1. Open settings.py and add ‘south’ to your list of INSTALLED_APPS
